brief_summary.textblock:
To assess the safety and efficacy of depot disulfiram as a new treatment for AIDS and AIDS
      related complex.

clinical_study.brief_title: Depot Disulfiram for AIDS and ARC

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria

        Patients must have a positive diagnosis of AIDS or AIDS related complex (ARC) according to
        the CDC criteria.

          -  Also patient must be:

          -  Able to understand the study.

          -  Strongly motivated to participate in the study, and willing to comply with all the
             conditions specified in the informed consent forms.

          -  Ambulatory and able to maintain an independent life outside the hospital.

          -  Free of clinically significant organic disease affecting neurologic, hepatic, renal,
             and clinical status.

        Patients must be free of clinically significant organic disease affecting neurologic,
        hepatic, renal, and clinical status.

        Patients must be free of clinically significant organic disease affecting neurologic,
        hepatic, renal, and clinical status.

        History of alcohol abuse.

clinical_study.official_title: Depot Disulfiram for AIDS and ARC

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
